184664209.review: Amazing frog is one of the best games to ever be created. This game is beyond human comprehension for how great a video game can become. The story, the graphics, the style that is used are all perfect. This is where humanity has reached its full potential. Amazing frog is literally...amazing. I haven't had any human contact ever since I have found this game. My entire life has been the amazing frog ever since I have come across it. Nothing will ever reach the pureness of this game. I don't think people understand just how great this is. Its not a video game on steam, its a lifestyle. I will follow this game until my dying breath. It is utterly incomprehensible to put into a review everything perfect about the amazing frog. It somehow manages to be completely unique, but masters every aspect. The humor, the character designs, the costumes, the giant toilet, the animals are all perfect. Perfect. Nothing better will ever emerge out of the humans as a race. There is nothing better than the amazing frog.

184118570.review:
Is it fun? Sure. 
Would I recommend you buy it? No.

It breaks my heart to write "Not Recommended" for Amazing Frog. I've been playing since the Ouya console release. The developers routinely added content over a decade and show no signs of stopping. It's fun to explore Swindon's many quirks  stashed in a very busy world. However, after playing Wobbly Life, I realized Amazing Frog lacks in very important areas. In a word, it's [b]janky[/b] .

While the game has expanded with additional areas, items, and gimmicks, the game has not grown into a complete project. The designs for online multiplayer appear to have gone by the wayside after the project split into Amazing Frog? And Amazing Frog? 2 - nearly identical from a gameplay standpoint, but different development pathways. The game(s) struggles to run on modern gaming PCs and suffers from layers of subsystems that impact performance as much as they impact gameplay. New features are implemented before old features are ironed out. 

Attempts to complete sandbox tasks are thwarted by physics more often than not. This can be funny when your frog bumps into a pole and toots, but that can be exhausting when you're just trying to get to a certain area for the 100th time. The NPCs are stiff and behave very strangely - even for bipedal frogs. 

Much love to the Fayju devs and their years of hard work. I hope Amazing Frog? gets transformed or rebuilt into something I can get back into. However, I don't think I'll be adding much more to my 9 hours of Steam playtime.
